intro: Psychotria nodiflora, commonly known as the clustered psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slight sheen. Psychotria nodiflora is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
